intro: Alyxia kaalaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Alyxia kaalaensis thrives in coastal and lowland habitats, and it plays an important role in the ecological diversity of Hawaii.
